attributes.additional_details: The advert slogan is Happy End Of The World. Not only is it saying the world will end next year but it also shows a man building an ark! As someone who is already apprehensive about 2012 and a christian it disturbed me to see it blatantly advertised on TV! Thankfully my children did not see it but no doubt it will soon be picked up and passed around the schools. Do we really need another reason for our children to fear the world they live in? Here is a link to the advert, also viewer comments (most of which mirror my concerns) http://www.lynxeffect.com/uk/lynx-videos/LYNX_2012_AD

Advertising in the UK is controlled through a system of co-regulation and self-regulation, which is administered by the Advertising Standards Authority (ASA). This regulatory system is independent of Government and is ultimately responsible for setting the standards in advertising.

You may wish to complain to the ASA. You can write to them at Advertising Standards Authority, Mid City Place, 71 High Holborn, London, WC1V 6QT, telephone on 020 7492 2222 / 020 7242 8159 or visit their website at www.asa.org.uk
